main event: An unidentified object was observed in Atlanta, Georgia on March 23, 1963, appearing like a shooting star or meteor.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for only 6-7 seconds with the object observed in the NE direction., The object left a long orange-blue trail edged with gold., The observation was classified as insufficient data for evaluation by both military and university officials., Observers misinterpreted the sighting as a meteor, despite it not being evaluated as one., The object appeared as a round light for a fraction of a second before changing shape.
sighted object: one unidentified flying object described as meteor-like
witness description: the observer noted a very bright object larger than a star and bluish in color with a gold edge
